artist: Artist: Attributed to Master ER; Artist: After Jacob Binck
catalogue_raissonne: Passavant IV, 169.2. Copy after: Bartsch 51 (vol. 8, p. 276), Aumüller 88, Hollstein 110
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure swooning against a tree, looking dramatically to his R at a grotesque, decaying figure with skull-like face and long hair who pulls at his arm; hourglass at figure's feet
inscription:
Date

in graphite on verso: Monogrammist E.R. | Death of a Soldier | copy after Binck | B.51 | Mon (with backwards \"R\" in end bracket) | Pass 1 169. 2 | illegible writing
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Death and the Foot Soldier
